items.message: This flood alert has been issued as the risk of heavy rain and thunderstorms remains for today and into this evening 21/07/25. There is uncertainty over the amount of rainfall expected and the exact location of these thunderstorms and heavy rain. River and surface water flooding may affect these areas. We urge you to remain vigilant and avoid walking and driving through flood water. We are continuing to actively monitor the situation closely and will issue updates, and further flood alerts and warnings if necessary. You can monitor your local weather conditions and river levels on the GOV.UK website.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Bradwell Brook, Dale Brook, Tideswell Brook, Warney Brook and Bentley Brook, Press Brook

items.message:
Small, flashier rivers and streams may respond to heavy rainfall as a result of the continued risk of localised thunderstorms passing through the area. This message has been issued pre-emptively as a result of today’s forecasted localised thunderstorms, expected until 21:00 on 21/07/25. Given the unpredictable nature of thunderstorms, there is low confidence in the locations and impacts of rainfall at this point. Areas most at risk are low lying agricultural land, roads and footpaths close to small rivers and streams. Water levels could rise rapidly and potentially generate deep, fast flows.
Thunderstorms are forecast to continue into the evening, 21/07/2025.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid contact with flood water.
To check the status of road closures online, please visit the One Network live map.
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 22/07/25, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Wyke Beck and Meanwood Beck catchments
items.message:
River levels in Wyke Beck have fallen below levels of concern following Sunday's heavy rainfall. As there remains a risk of further heavy, thundery showers this evening/overnight, any further rain could cause the river to rise rapidly again. We will continue to monitor the situation. 
 
Please take care around low-lying footpaths and roads near local watercourses.
We will update this message by 1000 on Tuesday 22/07/25 or if the situation changes.

items.description: The River Bure, Spixworth Beck and surrounding Becks
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to low lying land, roads and riverside areas is likely over the next few hours and into this evening, Monday 21st July. Areas most at risk are low lying roads and riverside areas between Horsford and Crostwick on the Spixworth Beck, and Corpusty, Saxthorpe, Itteringham, Ingworth, Aylsham and Burgh-next-Aylsham on the Bure. We are not currently expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. The forecast is for further showers this afternoon, clearing this evening. There's continued unsettled weather over the next couple of days. Take care on riverside footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 9am tomorrow, Tuesday 22nd July.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Polegate Brook Street Stream, Wannock Mill Stream

items.message: 17mm of rain has been recorded overnight Sunday into Monday. A lot less than could have been possible. A small river response has been observed, but it is not thought flooding from the river has occurred. River levels are now falling. There is a possibility of between 5 – 15mm of rain forecast for the rest of Monday, but this is not expected to cause significant river rise. Minor flood impacts could still be possible if an intense shower affects Polegate, but the likelihood is low. Please remain prepared for minor flood impacts. If you see a blockage affecting the river, please call our incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. We regularly clear debris from grilles at Gosford Way, to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will re-issue this Flood Alert if property flooding is thought possible.

7mm of rain has been recorded overnight Sunday into Monday. A lot less than forecast. A small river response has been observed, but it is not thought flooding from the river has occurred. River levels are now normal. There is a possibility of between 5 – 15mm of rain forecast for the rest of Monday, but this is not expected to cause significant river rise. Minor flood impacts could still be possible if an intense shower affects Hastings, but the likelihood is low. Please remain prepared for minor flood impacts. Keep flood protection products installed on Stonehouse Drive, if you have them. We regularly clear debris from grilles at Stonehouse Drive and along the Hollington Stream, to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will re-issue this Flood Alert if property flooding is thought possible.

7mm of rain has been recorded overnight Sunday into Monday. A lot less than forecast. A small river response has been observed, but it is not thought flooding from the river has occurred. River levels are now normal. There is a possibility of between 5 – 15mm of rain forecast for the rest of Monday, but this is not expected to cause significant river rise. Minor flood impacts could still be possible if an intense shower affects Hastings, but the likelihood is low. Please remain prepared for minor flood impacts. We continue to monitor river levels and forecast. We will re-issue this Flood Alert if property flooding is thought possible.
